control.name: Score
control.helpHtml: The score control is useful for letting users select from a range of values to vote on a given point. This control is best used for displaying single characters, such as a letter or a number. This control can also be stylised using CSS, and appears differently depending on the theme chosen.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Form summary label
property.helpHtml: Summary label to appear at the end of the form. Leave blank to have the control and its value hidden.

property.name: Options
property.helpHtml: Defines what the score values will be. An option for enabling codes can also be used. Codes allow for more precise visibility and validation conditions.

property.name: Initial value
property.helpHtml: Selects one of the score values as its initial value.

control.getDataFunction: // return the data-value of span with .selectedScore class return $("#" + id).children(".selectedScore").attr("data-value");
